title: The launch of Data as Culture 2 in photographs

details.description: The second Open Data Institute (ODI) Data as Culture exhibition opened its doors yesterday evening (24 March, 2014). The exhibition explores our relationship with surveillance, privacy and personal data.
details.excerpt: The [second Open Data Institute (ODI) Data as Culture exhibition](http://theodi.org/data-as-culture-2014) opened its doors yesterday evening (24 March, 2014). The exhibition explores our relationship with surveillance, privacy and personal data.
details.alternative_title: Data as Culture: private view photographs
details.content:
The second Open Data Institute (ODI) Data as Culture exhibition opened its doors yesterday evening (24 March, 2014). The exhibition explores our relationship with surveillance, privacy and personal data.

Artists included; James Bridle, James Brooks, Paolo Cirio, YoHa, Sam Meech and thickear.

The curator of this year's collection is Shiri Shalmy.

related.title: Data as Culture: who really owns our data?
